content: this legal document provides a summary of a case that took place in ghent on march 10th 2016 it discusses the rights to property in a marriage specifically focusing on contributions made to immovable property in the event of a divorce or dissolution the document explains that contributions cannot have conditions that go against the rules of the matrimonial property system as this would compromise the rights of creditors contributions with conditional terms are recorded in mortgage registers the document also addresses objections to contributions made with resolutive conditions highlighting the validity of these contributions and the protection of creditors rights the court of appeal supported by the notaryliquidator of the first court upholds the validity of contributions made with resolutive conditions in a divorce dismissing objections and affirming the statement of liquidationdistribution the decision was made by the chairman of the court of appeal on march 10 2016 the parties involved are identified by initials the document concludes that the resolutive condition is valid and the contributing spouse is entitled to compensation and the property dismissing the objection raised by the other spouse
